availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Margaret Julia Black Ross (Boone County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, resident. Daughter of Mitchell Michael Black and Mary Schultz Black. Married to William Ross in Boone County, Kentucky, on January 5, 1854. Mother of Vincent Ross, Mary Ross, and Amanda A. Ross. Resident in Boone County in 1850. Resident in Boone County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 152A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Union, p. 387.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 5, p. 60B.
Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, District 5, p. 12B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boone County Marriages, Film #000523724, p. 554.
